Keep working hard Graduates!

- Aaniya Bell

Harvey is number 6 of nine children. His desire is to play basketball. He has played ball since he was able to walk.

During his senior year he worked 2 jobs for most of the year. He plans to go into a trade after high school.

Harvey began his school career in Cabarrus County Schools when it was discovered that their school system was not a good fit so we changed to Cabarrus Charter Academy in his 5th grade year.

He looks forward to graduating but loves the Charter School for giving him the first of his many new beginnings.

With the possibility of inclement weather on Thursday, February 20th, the National Weather Center issuing a Winter Weather Advisory scheduled to begin at Noon, and wintry weather anticipated to begin around 1:00 PM in the Concord area Cabarrus Charter will be closing early.

We will be closing the Upper Campus at 12:00 PM and the Lower Campus at 12:30 PM to ensure the safe travel of our students and staff. All after school events including after-school care, tutoring, and any sports-related events are canceled.

Please know safety is our top priority.

Have a wonderful evening!

Good evening, Cabarrus Families.

We hope each of you are safe and sound. Tomorrow, Friday, February 7th, 2020 students will report on a two-hour delay. Lower Campus students will start entry at 9:30 AM and Upper Campus students will start entry at 9:00 AM. If weather and/or road conditions deteriorate overnight we will provide an update no later than 7:30 AM.

Please follow us on social media to receive any additional updates.

We appreciate your support.

Stay safe.

Sheena Miracle
Principal of Cabarrus Charter Academy, K-12
One School. Success for All.

As we celebrate National School Choice Week (NSCW), we received this testimony from parent who has been with CCA for 4 years... here is what she said.

CCA is a great school of choice!! Mrs. Miracle is an amazing principal. She truly cares about the staff and students. The staff seem very happy and they treat the students with respect. They truly care about the students academically and personally. If I have ever had an issue or question it has been addressed right away. My son is in 9th grade and has been at CCA since 5th grade. He plans on graduating from CCA. I feel lucky to have my son in such a caring and safe school environment.
